metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7656 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
jquery prior to 1.9.0 allows Cross-site Scripting attacks via the loadmethod. The load method fails to recognize and remove "<script>" HTML tagsthat contain a whitespace character, i.e: "</script >", which results inthe enclosed script logic to be executed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-jquery - 3.2.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jquery package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.1-1').
